prop.name: downloadUrl
prop.desc: If the file can be downloaded, URL to download the binary.

prop.name: softwareRequirements
prop.desc: Component dependency requirements for application. This includes runtime environments and shared libraries that are not included in the application distribution package, but required to run the application (Examples: DirectX, Java or .NET runtime).

prop.name: permissions
prop.desc: Permission(s) required to run the app (for example, a mobile app may require full internet access or may run only on wifi).

prop.name: processorRequirements
prop.desc: Processor architecture required to run the application (e.g. IA64).

prop.name: availableOnDevice
prop.desc: Device required to run the application. Used in cases where a specific make/model is required to run the application.

prop.name: featureList
prop.desc: Features or modules provided by this application (and possibly required by other applications).

prop.name: applicationSubCategory
prop.desc: Subcategory of the application, e.g. 'Arcade Game'.

prop.name: device
prop.desc: Device required to run the application. Used in cases where a specific make/model is required to run the application.

prop.name: applicationCategory
prop.desc: Type of software application, e.g. 'Game, Multimedia'.

prop.name: softwareVersion
prop.desc: Version of the software instance.

prop.name: storageRequirements
prop.desc: Storage requirements (free space required).

prop.name: applicationSuite
prop.desc: The name of the application suite to which the application belongs (e.g. Excel belongs to Office).

prop.name: memoryRequirements
prop.desc: Minimum memory requirements.

prop.name: screenshot
prop.desc: A link to a screenshot image of the app.

prop.name: countriesSupported
prop.desc: Countries for which the application is supported. You can also provide the two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.

prop.name: softwareHelp
prop.desc: Software application help.

prop.name: softwareAddOn
prop.desc: Additional content for a software application.

prop.name: releaseNotes
prop.desc: Description of what changed in this version.

prop.name: supportingData
prop.desc: Supporting data for a SoftwareApplication.

prop.name: requirements
prop.desc: Component dependency requirements for application. This includes runtime environments and shared libraries that are not included in the application distribution package, but required to run the application (Examples: DirectX, Java or .NET runtime).

prop.name: countriesNotSupported
prop.desc: Countries for which the application is not supported. You can also provide the two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.

prop.name: operatingSystem
prop.desc: Operating systems supported (Windows 7, OSX 10.6, Android 1.6).

prop.name: fileSize
prop.desc: Size of the application / package (e.g. 18MB). In the absence of a unit (MB, KB etc.), KB will be assumed.

prop.name: installUrl
prop.desc: URL at which the app may be installed, if different from the URL of the item.

CreativeWork.name: about
CreativeWork.desc: The subject matter of the content.

CreativeWork.name: educationalAlignment
CreativeWork.desc: An alignment to an established educational framework.

CreativeWork.name: associatedMedia
CreativeWork.desc: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for encoding.

CreativeWork.name: funder
CreativeWork.desc: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

CreativeWork.name: position
CreativeWork.desc: The position of an item in a series or sequence of items.

CreativeWork.name: audio
CreativeWork.desc: An embedded audio object.

CreativeWork.name: workExample
CreativeWork.desc: Example/instance/realization/derivation of the concept of this creative work. eg. The paperback edition, first edition, or eBook.

CreativeWork.name: provider
CreativeWork.desc: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

CreativeWork.name: encoding
CreativeWork.desc: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for associatedMedia.

CreativeWork.name: interactivityType
CreativeWork.desc: The predominant mode of learning supported by the learning resource. Acceptable values are 'active', 'expositive', or 'mixed'.

CreativeWork.name: accessibilitySummary
CreativeWork.desc: A human-readable summary of specific accessibility features or deficiencies, consistent with the other accessibility metadata but expressing subtleties such as "short descriptions are present but long descriptions will be needed for non-visual users" or "short descriptions are present and no long descriptions are needed."

CreativeWork.name: character
CreativeWork.desc: Fictional person connected with a creative work.

CreativeWork.name: audience
CreativeWork.desc: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

CreativeWork.name: sourceOrganization
CreativeWork.desc: The Organization on whose behalf the creator was working.

CreativeWork.name: isPartOf
CreativeWork.desc: Indicates a CreativeWork that this CreativeWork is (in some sense) part of.

CreativeWork.name: video
CreativeWork.desc: An embedded video object.

CreativeWork.name: publisher
CreativeWork.desc: The publisher of the creative work.

CreativeWork.name: publication
CreativeWork.desc: A publication event associated with the item.

CreativeWork.name: text
CreativeWork.desc: The textual content of this CreativeWork.

CreativeWork.name: expires
CreativeWork.desc: Date the content expires and is no longer useful or available. For example a VideoObject or NewsArticle whose availability or relevance is time-limited, or a ClaimReview fact check whose publisher wants to indicate that it may no longer be relevant (or helpful to highlight) after some date.

CreativeWork.name: contributor
CreativeWork.desc: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork or Event.

CreativeWork.name: reviews
CreativeWork.desc: Review of the item.

CreativeWork.name: typicalAgeRange
CreativeWork.desc: The typical expected age range, e.g. '7-9', '11-'.

CreativeWork.name: releasedEvent
CreativeWork.desc: The place and time the release was issued, expressed as a PublicationEvent.

CreativeWork.name: educationalUse
CreativeWork.desc: The purpose of a work in the context of education; for example, 'assignment', 'group work'.

CreativeWork.name: contentLocation
CreativeWork.desc: The location depicted or described in the content. For example, the location in a photograph or painting.

CreativeWork.name: schemaVersion
CreativeWork.desc: Indicates (by URL or string) a particular version of a schema used in some CreativeWork. For example, a document could declare a schemaVersion using an URL such as http://schema.org/version/2.0/ if precise indication of schema version was required by some application.

CreativeWork.name: accessibilityFeature
CreativeWork.desc: Content features of the resource, such as accessible media, alternatives and supported enhancements for accessibility (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

CreativeWork.name: aggregateRating
CreativeWork.desc: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

CreativeWork.name: alternativeHeadline
CreativeWork.desc: A secondary title of the CreativeWork.

CreativeWork.name: locationCreated
CreativeWork.desc: The location where the CreativeWork was created, which may not be the same as the location depicted in the CreativeWork.

CreativeWork.name: accessModeSufficient
CreativeWork.desc: A list of single or combined accessModes that are sufficient to understand all the intellectual content of a resource. Expected values include:  auditory, tactile, textual, visual.

CreativeWork.name: temporalCoverage
CreativeWork.desc: The temporalCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the period that the content applies to, i.e. that it describes, either as a DateTime or as a textual string indicating a time period in ISO 8601 time interval format. In the case of a Dataset it will typically indicate the relevant time period in a precise notation (e.g. for a 2011 census dataset, the year 2011 would be written "2011/2012"). Other forms of content e.g. ScholarlyArticle, Book, TVSeries or TVEpisode may indicate their temporalCoverage in broader terms - textually or via well-known URL. Written works such as books may sometimes have precise temporal coverage too, e.g. a work set in 1939 - 1945 can be indicated in ISO 8601 interval format format via "1939/1945".

CreativeWork.name: accountablePerson
CreativeWork.desc: Specifies the Person that is legally accountable for the CreativeWork.

CreativeWork.name: spatialCoverage
CreativeWork.desc:
The spatialCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the place(s) which are the focus of the content. It is a subproperty of
      contentLocation intended primarily for more technical and detailed materials. For example with a Dataset, it indicates
      areas that the dataset describes: a dataset of New York weather would have spatialCoverage which was the place: the state of New York.

CreativeWork.name: offers
CreativeWork.desc: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event.

CreativeWork.name: editor
CreativeWork.desc: Specifies the Person who edited the CreativeWork.

CreativeWork.name: discussionUrl
CreativeWork.desc: A link to the page containing the comments of the CreativeWork.

CreativeWork.name: award
CreativeWork.desc: An award won by or for this item.

CreativeWork.name: copyrightHolder
CreativeWork.desc: The party holding the legal copyright to the CreativeWork.

CreativeWork.name: accessibilityHazard
CreativeWork.desc: A characteristic of the described resource that is physiologically dangerous to some users. Related to WCAG 2.0 guideline 2.3 (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

CreativeWork.name: copyrightYear
CreativeWork.desc: The year during which the claimed copyright for the CreativeWork was first asserted.

CreativeWork.name: awards
CreativeWork.desc: Awards won by or for this item.

CreativeWork.name: recordedAt
CreativeWork.desc: The Event where the CreativeWork was recorded. The CreativeWork may capture all or part of the event.

CreativeWork.name: commentCount
CreativeWork.desc: The number of comments this CreativeWork (e.g. Article, Question or Answer) has received. This is most applicable to works published in Web sites with commenting system; additional comments may exist elsewhere.

CreativeWork.name: fileFormat
CreativeWork.desc: Media type, typically MIME format (see IANA site) of the content e.g. application/zip of a SoftwareApplication binary. In cases where a CreativeWork has several media type representations, 'encoding' can be used to indicate each MediaObject alongside particular fileFormat information. Unregistered or niche file formats can be indicated instead via the most appropriate URL, e.g. defining Web page or a Wikipedia entry.

CreativeWork.name: inLanguage
CreativeWork.desc: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the IETF BCP 47 standard. See also availableLanguage.

CreativeWork.name: accessibilityAPI
CreativeWork.desc: Indicates that the resource is compatible with the referenced accessibility API (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

CreativeWork.name: interactionStatistic
CreativeWork.desc: The number of interactions for the CreativeWork using the WebSite or SoftwareApplication. The most specific child type of InteractionCounter should be used.

CreativeWork.name: contentRating
CreativeWork.desc: Official rating of a piece of content—for example,'MPAA PG-13'.

CreativeWork.name: learningResourceType
CreativeWork.desc: The predominant type or kind characterizing the learning resource. For example, 'presentation', 'handout'.

CreativeWork.name: accessMode
CreativeWork.desc: The human sensory perceptual system or cognitive faculty through which a person may process or perceive information. Expected values include: auditory, tactile, textual, visual, colorDependent, chartOnVisual, chemOnVisual, diagramOnVisual, mathOnVisual, musicOnVisual, textOnVisual.

CreativeWork.name: material
CreativeWork.desc: A material that something is made from, e.g. leather, wool, cotton, paper.

CreativeWork.name: isFamilyFriendly
CreativeWork.desc: Indicates whether this content is family friendly.

CreativeWork.name: exampleOfWork
CreativeWork.desc: A creative work that this work is an example/instance/realization/derivation of.

CreativeWork.name: version
CreativeWork.desc: The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource.

CreativeWork.name: dateModified
CreativeWork.desc: The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.

CreativeWork.name: mainEntity
CreativeWork.desc: Indicates the primary entity described in some page or other CreativeWork.

CreativeWork.name: genre
CreativeWork.desc: Genre of the creative work, broadcast channel or group.

CreativeWork.name: keywords
CreativeWork.desc: Keywords or tags used to describe this content. Multiple entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas.

CreativeWork.name: author
CreativeWork.desc: The author of this content or rating. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.

CreativeWork.name: isBasedOnUrl
CreativeWork.desc: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html.

CreativeWork.name: timeRequired
CreativeWork.desc: Approximate or typical time it takes to work with or through this learning resource for the typical intended target audience, e.g. 'P30M', 'P1H25M'.

CreativeWork.name: translator
CreativeWork.desc: Organization or person who adapts a creative work to different languages, regional differences and technical requirements of a target market, or that translates during some event.

CreativeWork.name: thumbnailUrl
CreativeWork.desc: A thumbnail image relevant to the Thing.

CreativeWork.name: hasPart
CreativeWork.desc: Indicates a CreativeWork that is (in some sense) a part of this CreativeWork.

CreativeWork.name: comment
CreativeWork.desc: Comments, typically from users.

CreativeWork.name: review
CreativeWork.desc: A review of the item.

CreativeWork.name: license
CreativeWork.desc: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.

CreativeWork.name: accessibilityControl
CreativeWork.desc: Identifies input methods that are sufficient to fully control the described resource (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

CreativeWork.name: encodings
CreativeWork.desc: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork.

CreativeWork.name: isBasedOn
CreativeWork.desc: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html.

CreativeWork.name: creator
CreativeWork.desc: The creator/author of this CreativeWork. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork.

CreativeWork.name: publishingPrinciples
CreativeWork.desc:
The publishingPrinciples property indicates (typically via URL) a document describing the editorial principles of an Organization (or individual e.g. a Person writing a blog) that relate to their activities as a publisher, e.g. ethics or diversity policies. When applied to a CreativeWork (e.g. NewsArticle) the principles are those of the party primarily responsible for the creation of the CreativeWork.

While such policies are most typically expressed in natural language, sometimes related information (e.g. indicating a funder) can be expressed using schema.org terminology.

CreativeWork.name: sponsor
CreativeWork.desc: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. e.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

CreativeWork.name: producer
CreativeWork.desc: The person or organization who produced the work (e.g. music album, movie, tv/radio series etc.).

CreativeWork.name: mentions
CreativeWork.desc: Indicates that the CreativeWork contains a reference to, but is not necessarily about a concept.

CreativeWork.name: dateCreated
CreativeWork.desc: The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed.

CreativeWork.name: datePublished
CreativeWork.desc: Date of first broadcast/publication.

CreativeWork.name: isAccessibleForFree
CreativeWork.desc: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.

CreativeWork.name: headline
CreativeWork.desc: Headline of the article.

CreativeWork.name: citation
CreativeWork.desc: A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.
